titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Joshua B. Powers collection
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Paul Karpuk, revised by Hoover Institution Archives Staff

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-11-28T15:03-0800

change.item: Revised to add map case for rehoused map from Box 7. - Paige Davenport
Revised to add box for rehoused scrapbook, boxes 8-9.
Revised to add boxes for rehoused photographs and scrapbooks.
Revised to update encoding by Samira Bozorgi.
Updated register to include photographs and microfilm.
PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Joshua B. Powers Collection)//EN" "powersjb.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

physdesc.extent: 7 manuscript boxes, 3 oversize boxes, 1 oversize folder

did.abstract: Correspondence, telegrams, biographies, articles, pamphlets, clippings, writings, photographs, maps, scrapbooks, and memorabilia relating to Homer Lea, military adviser to Sun Yat-sen and author of The Valor of Ignorance, and to the revolutionary movement in China, circa 1900-1920. Includes writings and correspondence of Homer Lea, Ethel Lea, and Joshua B. Powers.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Joshua B. Powers collection, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1968.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

eventgrp.event: Representative, <title render="italic">La Prensa</title>, Buenos Aires, Argentina, and other publications, New York City
Manager, United Press Association, Buenos Aires; chairman of Joshua B. Powers, Inc.; representative of newspapers in foreign countries
Recipient, U.S. Cabot award, Columbia University; Commendator Order of Bernardo O'Higgins (Chile); Official Ordem Cruzeiro Do Sul (Brazil); gold medal, Pan American Society

chronitem.event: Lieutenant-General, Imperial Reform Army, China, under Kang Yu Wei, Grand President, Chinese Empire Reform Association
Undertook relief of Kwang Hsu, Emperor of China
Organized Chinese military schools in U.S. and Chinese Imperial Army (C.I.A.)
Author, The Day of the Saxon

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, telegrams, biographies, articles, pamphlets, clippings, writings, photographs, maps, scrapbooks, and memorabilia relating to Homer Lea, military adviser to Sun Yat-sen and author of The Valor of Ignorance, and to the revolutionary movement in China, circa 1900-1920. Includes writings and correspondence of Homer Lea, Ethel Lea, and Joshua B. Powers.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Statement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized into six series: Correspondence of Homer Lea and Ethel Lea (Mrs. Homer Lea), Correspondence of Joshua B. Powers and Albert H. Powers, Collected Writings of Homer Lea, Collected Writings of Joshua B. Powers, Subject File, Miscellany, and Photographs.

did.unittitle: Correspondence of Homer Lea and Ethel Lea (Mrs. Homer Lea),

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by last name of correspondent.

did.unittitle: First National Bank of Los Angeles,
Correspondence of Joshua B. Powers and Albert H. Powers,

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by last name of correspondent.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typewritten and handwritten drafts; carbon, mimeographed, and printed copies; outlines and notes; and correspondence, publishing contracts, book reviews, and royalty statements pertaining to books and articles, arranged alphabetically by title of manuscript.

did.unittitle: "Can China Fight?," The World Today, printed copy,
Typewritten second draft, with handwritten notes and corrections
"The Defenses of China," two typewritten drafts,
"How Socialism Failed in China," Van Norden's Magazine, printed copy,
"The Legacy of Commodore Perry," North American Review, outline, printed copy, and correspondence,
"The Reawakening of China," outline and notes for unfinished book,
"The Red Dawn of the New China," typewritten first draft, mimeographed copy of second draft,
"A Romance of the Tombs," two typewritten drafts,
"The Vandal," typewritten draft of unfinished story,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Drafts, newspaper articles, outlines and notes.

did.unittitle: Untitled manuscript on life and works of Homer Lea,
Newspaper articles on Homer Lea (extracts from manuscript),
Outline and typewritten draft on Homer Lea

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Letters, articles, newspaper clippings, pamphlets, books, and printed matter, arranged alphabetically by subject.

did.unittitle: Belford, Robert J., poems and letters,
Chinese-American Educational Association, Articles of Agreement,
Chinese Exclusion Act, letter issued by Chinese Protective Association, Los Angeles, to U.S. Senators and Congressmen,
Chinese Imperial Army: Chinese military schools in the U.S.A.
Clowe, Clarence, State Capitalism in Ancient China, printed copy,
Defense of China and General Duvall's letter to President Theodore Roosevelt
Evans, I. H., "The Latest Republic," The Watchman, printed copy,
Newspaper clippings on Homer Lea's funeral in Taipei,
Carr, Harry, collected newspaper articles and interview transcripts, typewritten carbon copies,
Chapin, Frederic, unpublished biography, typewritten carbon copy,
Dinegar, Capt. W. W. and Major Avery E. Kolb, "The Bitter Tea of Homer Lea," typewritten draft,
Medical report by Dr. M. Urbanek,
O'Banion, Capt. Ansel E., autobiographical statements,
Sun Yat-Sen, speeches and writings, articles, letters,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Addresses, banknotes, calling cards, invitations, legal papers, maps, memorabilia, newspaper clippings, passport and scrapbooks, arranged as listed.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 145 photos, 7 duplicates, 24 negatives, 1 album, and 5 envelopes. Includes depictions of the Lea family, Chinese Imperial Army training, and China during the revolutionary period, as well as other images.

did.unittitle: 9 photos of prominent Chinese intellectuals, such as Kan Yi Wei, Sun Yat-sen, Liang Chi Chao, and Chu Cho-wen, plus 5 negatives,
11 photos and 6 duplicates plus 4 negatives of Homer Lea; 1 photo of the Lea family; 17 photos of friends and relatives, plus 1 duplicate,
25 photos and 6 negatives depicting Chinese Imperial Army training in California,
6 photos and 14 negatives of China, general
59 photos of China during the revolutionary period,
10 photos depicting Chinese Imperial Army training in California,
6 photos of Hwang Hsing with Ethel Lea (Mrs. Homer Lea)
8 prints depicting the ceremonial placement of ashes of Homer Lea and Ethel Bryant Lea in the military cemetery in Taipei, Taiwan,
